section.title: Overview
section.description: The Set Field Value action enters values into one or more fields on a form or browse layout.

step.description: Make a selection in the Set the value of fields in which window? field. This field will be grayed out unless this action is based on a Form or Browse. The choices are:
In the Window Name field select one of the open forms or browses.
Click the '+' icon button to add fields to the Set the value of the following fields list using the Select a Control dialog box, or click '-' icon to remove them.
For each field, select a value in How will you specify the field's value?. There are three options:

case.description: "Specify a variable the contains the value"
"Specify an expression that evaluates to the value"

step.description: If you selected "Specify the value now", enter a value in the Value field.
If you selected "Specify a variable the contains the value", click the Value icon to select an existing variable in the Variable field.
If you selected "Specify an expression that evaluates to the value", enter an expression into the Expression field. Optionally, click the x-y icon to use the Expression Builder.
Optionally modify the comment that describes the action.
